snippet.title: New smart 'glue' for heart surgery activated by UV light
snippet.description: Unlike existing surgical adhesives, the new glue works even in the presence of blood and seals within five seconds of exposure to UV light.

snippet.title: Facebook weaves new network fabric
snippet.description: The social-networking giant is developing a new networking "fabric" to relieve bottlenecks within its data centers and speed deployment of new apps.

snippet.title: Uniface mask: Glue on some bionic skin, feel fabulous
snippet.description: Could getting a new face be as easy as ordering a mask online? One woman's statement on beauty has giant anime eyes, long lashes, and a high nose bridge to help you meet today's standards.

snippet.title: New smart fabric mimics the way skin perspires
snippet.description: UC Davis biomedical engineers turn to human skin for inspiration in creating a new moisture-wicking fabric.

snippet.title: Fabric + algorithm: The fit geek's quest for a suit that fits
snippet.description: A couple of fashion guys team up with a space geek to help men buy the best fitting suit online and try to rise above the tech fit fray.

snippet.title: Lumi Process: Print on fabric using sunlight
snippet.description: Harness the power of the sun and special inks to permanently fix images to fabrics. Finally, you can make your own Instagram T-shirts.

snippet.title: iPad mini reveals Samsung drivers, loads of glue in teardown
snippet.description: The iPad mini has been rent asunder, revealing a glued-shut tablet that's nigh-on impossible to repair.

snippet.title: BMW to use touch-sensitive smart fabric in cars
snippet.description: As car makers look for ways to replace unsightly buttons or add more controls without crowding the center stack, researchers are turning to smart fabric.

snippet.title: IBM, 3M team up on 3D semiconductor 'glue'
snippet.description: 3M and IBM hope to roll out 3D chip adhesives in 2013. Get ready for processors with stacks of 100 chips.

snippet.title: Car Tech Live 249: BMW sews up touch sensitive fabric
snippet.description: BMW says touch me, Ford takes mirrors high tech for quiet, the Chevy Volt is off the hook with the Feds, and how much would you pay for Obama's Chrysler 300?
